repnme.cdata!:
Argentina - AIDS and Sexually Transmitted
            Diseases Control Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The ratings for the project were as
            follows: the outcome was satisfactory, the sustainability
            was likely, the institutional development impact was
            substantial, and the Bank and borrower performance were both
            satisfactory,. There are at least five key lessons to be
            derived from the design and implementation of the AIDS and
            Sexually Transmitted Disease Control Project (LUSIDA)
            project: (a) Ensuring up-front political support and
            commitment for important, and often politically difficult,
            HIV/AIDS policy changes is crucial to effectively address
            the HIV/AIDS epidemic; (b) Involving NGOs during project
            preparation is necessary to ensure buy-in from civil society
            as main actors in project implementation and to ensure
            accountability of policy makers in HIV/AIDS prevention
            policy; (c) Reaching clear agreements and setting effective
            monitoring of counterpart funds during project preparation
            is essential to ensure they will be available during project
            implementation; (d) Early and effective integration of
            project activities to the mainstream implementing agency
            responsibilities and organization is essential to ensure
            project sustainability; (e) Ensuring ownership and
            commitment by decentralized agencies and local governments,
            who have the ultimate responsibility for implementing policy
            and project activities, is essential for achieving both,
            Development and Implementation objectives.

694122.trustfund:
TF040403-ARGENTINA:  AIDS AND STD
            CONTROL PROJECT,TF037805-ARGENTINA - AIDS PREVENTION AND
            STD CONTROL,TF034234-ARGENTINA - AIDS CONTROL,TF029515-PHRD-AIDS PREVENTION PROJECT (APP)

repnme.cdata!:
Argentina - AIDS and Sexually Transmitted
            Diseases Control Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The objectives of the AIDS and Sexually
            Transmitted Diseases Control Project are to reduce the
            growth rate of the incidence of HIV infection by 15 percent.
            The project components involve financing mostly HIV/AIDS-
            and STD-related health promotion and disease prevention
            activities, with an emphasis on the Federal Capital and on
            the provinces of Buenos Aires, Cordoba, and Santa Fe, where
            85 percent of HIV cases are concentrated. Specifically, the
            components involve: (1) mass and targeted communication
            campaigns, and primary and secondary educational materials,
            teacher training, and participatory projects on HIV/AIDS and
            STDS; (2) HIV/AIDS and STD prevention through Civil Society
            Organization-based or governmental behavior intervention
            subprojects for specific at-risk groups as well as for the
            general population, blood bank quality control, and HIV
            diagnosis and treatment in prenatal care; (3) diagnosis,
            treatment, and care of HIV infection and STDs, by
            establishing anonymous diagnostic and counseling centers,
            strengthening or developing laboratories, day care services,
            and home care services, and training physicians and other
            health care personnel; (4) monitoring, evaluation, and
            research, including strengthening the HIV/AIDS management
            information system, training in completing official forms
            and statistics, and in epidemiology and planning, reviewing
            financial and management arrangements, and undertaking
            research and development studies; and (5) project administration.
